author: Gustave Flaubert
quote: Travel makes one modest, you see what a tiny place you occupy in the world.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness.

author: Henry Miller
quote: One's destination is never a place, but always a new way of seeing things.

author: D.H. Lawrence
quote: When we get out of the glass bottle of our ego and when we escape like the squirrels in the cage of our personality and get into the forest again, we shall shiver with cold and fright. But things will happen to us so that we don't know ourselves. Cool, unlying life will rush in.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: I dislike feeling at home when I'm abroad.

author: Dagobert D. Runes
quote: People travel to faraway places to watch, in fascination, the people they ignore at home.

author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
quote: A man of ordinary talent will always be ordinary, whether he travels or not; but a man of superior talent will go to pieces if he remains forever in the same place.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Not until we are lost do we begin to understand ourselves.

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: For the born traveller, travelling is a besetting vice. Like other vices, it is imperious, demanding its victim's time, money, energy and the sacrifice of comfort.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
quote: Like all great travellers, I have seen more than I remember, and remember more than I have seen.

author: Pat Conroy
quote: Once you have travelled, the voyage never ends, but is played out over and over again in the quietest chambers. The mind can never break off from the journey.

author: Mohamed
quote: Don't tell me how educated you are, tell me how much you travelled.

author: T.S. Eliot
quote: The journey not the arrival matters.

author: Kurt Vonnegut
quote: Bizarre travel plans are dancing lessons from God.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things you didn't do than by the ones you did. So throw off the bowlines, sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in you sail. Explore. Dream. Discover.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: I never travel without my diary. One should always have something sensational to read in the train.

author: Marcel Proust
quote: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeing new landscapes, but in having new eyes.

author: Seneca
quote: Travel and change of place impart new vigour to the mind.

author: Martin Buber
quote: All journeys have secret destinations of which the traveller is unaware.

author: Robert Frost
quote: Two roads diverged in a wood and I â€“ I took the one less travelled by.

author: Thomas Fuller
quote: If an ass goes travelling, he'll not come home a horse.

author: Paul Theroux
quote: Tourists don't know where they've been, travellers don't know where they're going.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: A good traveller has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
quote: There are no foreign lands. It is the traveller only who is foreign.

author: John Steinbeck
quote: A journey is like marriage. The certain way to be wrong is to think you control it.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: I love to travel, but hate to arrive.

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: To travel is to discover that everyone is wrong about other countries.

author: Lisa St. Aubin de Teran
quote: Travelling is like flirting with life. It's like saying, 'I would stay and love you, but I have to go; this is my station'.

author: John Steinbeck
quote: People don't take trips... trips take people.

author: Cesare Pavese
quote: If you wish to travel far and fast, travel light. Take off all your envies, jealousies, unforgiveness, selfishness and fears.

author: Hilaire Belloc
quote: We wander for distraction, but we travel for fulfilment.

author: Caskie Stinnett
quote: I travel a lot; I hate having my life disrupted my routine.

author: Charles Horton Cooley
quote: To get away from one's working environment is, in a sense, to get away from one's self; and this is often the chief advantage of travel and change.

author: Herman Melville
quote: It is not down in any map; true places never are.

author: Elizabeth Drew
quote: Too often travel, instead of broadening the mind, merely lengthens the conversation.

author: J.R.R. Tolkein
quote: Not all those who wander are lost.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Though we travel the world over to find the beautiful, we must carry it with us or we find it not.

author: G.K. Chesterton
quote: The whole object of travel is not to set foot on foreign land; it is at least to set foot on one's own country as a foreign land.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Do not follow where the path may lead. Go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
quote: Travel teaches toleration

author: Andre Gide
quote: One doesn't discover new lands without consenting to lose sight of the shore for a very long time.

author: Tim Cahill
quote: A journey is best measured in friends, rather than miles.

author: Anatole France
quote: Wandering re-establishes the original harmony which once existed between man and the universe.

author: Ray Bradbury
quote: Half of the fun of travel is the aesthetic of lostness.

author: St Augustine
quote: The world is a book and those who do not travel only read one page.

author: Jack Kerouac
quote: Our battered suitcases were piled on the sidewalk again; we had longer ways to go. But no matter, the road is life.

author: Freya Stark
quote: To awaken quite alone in a strange town is one of the pleasantest sensations in the world.

author: Pico Iyer
quote: And if travel is like love, it is, in the end, mostly because it's a heightened state of awareness, in which we are mindful, receptive, undimmed by familiarity and ready to be transformed. That is why the best trips, like the best love affairs, never really end.
